feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 4:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Flooding from Lake Drainage near Nuiqsut... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued June 28 at 3:45PM AKDT until July 01 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 1 AM AKDT FRIDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY FROM THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER NORTH... * Winds...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Timing...Hot, dry, and windy conditions are expected Thursday afternoon and evening.

entry.cap:areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 1:59PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIVER LEVELS THROUGH MID-WEEK... With record heat, significant snowmelt in higher terrain has caused high river levels and near bankfull conditions in rivers and streams throughout Upper Lynn Canal. This includes the Chilkat, the Klehini, and Taiya Rivers. No flooding is expected, although high water is anticipated.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway
